member.name: M:ComponentAce.Compression.Archiver.BaseArchiver.BeginUpdate
member.summary: Begins a transaction for open archive.
member.remarks:
Call BeginUpdate to start a group of operations called a transaction. All changes made by operations within single transaction can be saved by calling or cancelled by . BeginUpdate sets property to True.
ZipForge.NET transaction system provides archive integrity like reliable database systems.
Any transaction must be finished before extracting or testing files. Otherwise exception will be raised.

member.name: M:ComponentAce.Compression.Archiver.BaseArchiver.EndUpdate
member.summary: Finishes a transaction for open archive.
member.remarks:
EndUpdate saves all archive modifications made after calling and finishes current transaction. EndUpdate sets property to False.
Call to cancel archive modifications.

member.name: M:ComponentAce.Compression.Archiver.BaseArchiver.CancelUpdate
member.summary: Cancels all archive operations made after calling BeginUpdate.
member.remarks: Use CancelUpdate to rollback current transaction started by . CancelUpdate clears all archive modifications made after calling BeginUpdate. CancelUpdate sets property to False.

member.name: M:ComponentAce.Compression.Archiver.BaseArchiver.AddFromStream(System.String,System.IO.Stream)
member.overloads: Adds data stored in a stream to the archive.
member.summary: Adds data stored in a stream to the archive.
member.remarks:
Use AddFromStream to compress data stored in the Stream descendant object like FileStream, MemoryStream or BlobStream to the file inside the archive.
The position determines starting position in stream for adding data to the archive.
Count specifies size of the data in stream for adding to the archive. If count = 0 size of the data will be stream.Size - position. If count > 0 then AddFromStream copies stream data to the internal memory stream before processing.
By default all Stream contents will be added to the archive.
The attr parameter specifies file attributes which will be assigned to the stored file.
While using multiple AddFromStream calls within a single transaction, keep in mind that you may get an error if a stream object is destroyed before the call to the EndUpdate method. Please note that you should use separate stream objects for each AddFromStream call if you don't pass count > 0 parameter.
member.param: Specifies file name that will be used to store data from the Stream descendant object.
Stream to add data from.
member.remarks: Use AddFromStream to compress data stored in the Stream descendant object like FileStream, MemoryStream or BlobStream to the file inside the archive.

member.name: M:ComponentAce.Compression.Archiver.BaseArchiver.FindFirst(ComponentAce.Compression.Archiver.ArchiveItem@)
member.overloads: Finds files stored within the archive.
member.summary: Finds files stored within the archive using FileMasks and ExcusionMaskes propertes.
member.remarks:
Use FindFirst and to find files stored inside the open archive file. FindFirst return True if at least one file meets search conditions, otherwise it returns False. Use FindNext to find other files that meets search conditions.
After calling FindFirst f parameter will contain parameters of the first found file.
FindFirst variant with single parameter uses FileMasks, ExclusionMasks and Options.SearchAttr to specify search conditions and to exclude files from delete operation.
The fileMask parameter is the directory and file name mask, including wildcard characters. For example, "TEST\\*.*" specifies all files in the TEST directory stored within the archive file. First file that meets FileMask and SearchAttr will be found.
The searchAttr parameter specifies the special files to include in addition to all normal files
The exclusionMask specifies files to be excluded from delete operation.
member.param: ArchiveItem class.
member.returns: True if specified file was successfully found, otherwise it returns False.
member.remarks:

member.name: M:ComponentAce.Compression.Archiver.BaseArchiver.AddFiles
member.summary: Adds files to the archive using FileMasks and ExlusionMasks properies.
member.remarks:
Use AddFiles to add files to the open archive file. If you need to delete source files, use instead of AddFiles. If .Recurse is set to True, AddFiles will search files recursively.
AddFiles variant without parameters uses , and .SearchAttr properties to specify search conditions and to exclude files from add operation.
The fileMask parameter is the directory and file name mask, including wildcard characters. For example, "C:\TEST\*.*" specifies all files in the C:\TEST directory. All files that meets fileMask and searchAttr will be added to the archive.
The searchAttr parameter specifies the special files to include in addition to all normal files.
The exclusionMask specifies files to be excluded from add operation.
If you need to add certain files without compression set property. If some errors occurs an exception will be raised. Write an event handler to perform your own error handling.
If you need to change the name of the added file, use event handler.

member.name: M:ComponentAce.Compression.Archiver.BaseArchiver.MoveFiles
member.overloads: Adds files to the archive and deletes original files.
member.summary: Moves files to the archive using FileMasks and ExclusionMasks properties.
member.remarks:
Use MoveFiles to move files to the open archive file. MoveFiles deletes all files after they will be added to the archive. If you need to add files to the archive without deleting source files, use instead of MoveFiles. If .Recurse is set to True, MoveFiles will search files recursively.
MoveFiles variant without parameters uses , and .SearchAttr to specify search conditions and to exclude files from move operation.
The fileMask parameter is the directory and file name mask, including wildcard characters. For example, 'C:\TEST\*.*' specifies all files in the C:\TEST directory. All files that meets FileMask and SearchAttr will be moved to the archive.
The searchAttr parameter specifies the special files to include in addition to all normal files.
The exclusionMask specifies files to be excluded from move operation.
If you need to move certain files without compression set property. If some errors occurs an exception will be raised. Write an event handler to perform your own error handling.

Use MoveFiles to move files to the open archive file. MoveFiles deletes all files after they are added to the archive. If you need to add files to the archive without deleting source files, use instead of MoveFiles. If .Recurse is set to True, MoveFiles will search files recursively.
MoveFiles variant without parameters uses , and .SearchAttr to specify search conditions and to exclude files from move operation.

member.name: M:ComponentAce.Compression.Archiver.BaseArchiver.UpdateFiles
member.overloads: Updates files stored within the archive.
member.summary: Updates files stored within the archive using FileMasks and ExclusioMasks properties.
member.remarks:
Use UpdateFiles to update files stored within the open archive file. UpdateFiles searches for extrenal files specified by FileMask,SearchAttr and ExclusionMask parameters and property and synchronizes them with files stored within the archive. UpdateFiles uses .OverwriteMode to determine how to overwrite existing files inside the archive with external files from BaseDir. If Options.Recurse is set to True, UpdateFiles will search files recursively.
UpdateFiles variant without parameters uses FileMasks, ExclusionMasks and Options.SearchAttr to specify search conditions and to exclude files from update operation.
The fileMask parameter is the directory and file name mask, including wildcard characters. For example, "TEST\\*.*" specifies all files in the TEST directory stored within the archive file. All files that meets FileMask and SearchAttr will be updated.
The searchAttr parameter specifies the special files to include in addition to all normal files.
The exclusionMask specifies files to be excluded from update operation.
If you need to update certain files without compression set property. If some errors occurs an exception will be raised. Write an event handler to perform your own error handling.

Use UpdateFiles to update files stored within the open archive file. UpdateFiles uses .OverwriteMode to determine how to overwrite existing files inside the archive with external files from BaseDir. If Options.Recurse is set to True, UpdateFiles will search files recursively.
UpdateFiles variant without parameters uses FileMasks, ExclusionMasks and Options.SearchAttr to specify search conditions and to exclude files from update operation.

member.summary: Extracts files specified by FileMasks and ExclusionMasks properties from the archive.
member.remarks:
Use ExtractFiles to extract files from the open archive file. If .Recurse is set to True, ExtractFiles will search files recursively.
ExtractFiles variant without parameters uses , and Options.SearchAttr properties to specify search conditions and to exclude files from add operation. ExtractFiles variant with parameters uses procedure parameters and ignores FileMasks, ExclusionMasks and Options.SearchAttr properties.
The fileMask parameter is the directory and file name mask, including wildcard characters. For example, "TEST\\*.*" specifies all files in the TEST directory stored within the archive file. All files that meets FileMask and SearchAttr will be extracted from the archive.If FileMask is a blank string, no files will be extracted.
The searchAttr parameter specifies the special files to include in addition to all normal files.
The exclusionMask specifies files to be excluded from extract operation.
Any transaction must be finished before calling ExtractFiles. Otherwise an exception will be raised. Also if some other errors occurs an exception will be raised. Write an event handler to perform your own error handling.
Use property to specify whether extracting of corrupted files is allowed.
If you need to change the name of the extracted file, use event handler.

If an error occurs while opening the archive exception will be raised and archive file will be closed.
An application must set Active to False before creating new archive by calling with fmCreate mode.
Calling the OpenArchive method sets Active to True; calling the method sets Active to False.

member.remarks:

Set CompressionLevel to desired value before adding, moving or updating files.

member.name: P:ComponentAce.Compression.Archiver.BaseArchiver.CompressionMode
member.summary: Specifies the compression level used for archive updating.
member.remarks:
This property determines compression level for adding, moving or updating files. The correct values are integer numbers in range 0-9. Maximum value of CompressionMode corresponds to slow compression and best compression rate. The zero value means that files will not be compressed. If you need only to store files, set CompressionMode to 0.
Set CompressionMode to desired value before adding, moving or updating files.
The CompressionMode and properties influence each other. Setting one automatically determines value for the other.

member.name: P:ComponentAce.Compression.Archiver.BaseArchiver.FileMasks
member.summary: Specifies files or wildcards for archiver operations.
member.remarks:
FileMasks are used for overloaded versions without parameters of , , , , , and methods to select certain files for these operations. This property should contain list of directories and file names including wildcard characters. For example, "C:\\TEST\\*.*" specifies all files in the C:\TEST directory.
FileMasks property specifiec files that should be included into the operation, excluding files specified by . If you need to store certain files without compression use property.

member.name: P:ComponentAce.Compression.Archiver.BaseArchiver.ExclusionMasks
member.summary: Specifies files to be excluded from archive operations.
member.remarks:
ExclusionMasks are used for overloaded versions without parameters of , , , , , and methods to exclude certain files for these operations. This property should contain list of excluded directories and file names including wildcard characters. For example, 'C:\TEST\*.*' specifies all files in the C:\TEST directory.
Three types of exclusion masks can be specified:
A mask for the whole BaseDir and all its sub-folders.
A mask for the BaseDir only.
A mask for an exact full path.
For example:
*.txt - exclude *.txt in the BaseDir and its sub-folders
\*.txt - exclude *.txt files in the BaseDir only
C:\The\Full\Path\*.txt - exclude the *.txt files only in the C:\The\Full\Path folder.
property specifies files that should be included into the operation, excluding files specified by ExclusionMasks. If you need to store certain files without compression use property.

member.name: P:ComponentAce.Compression.Archiver.BaseArchiver.NoCompressionMasks
member.summary: Specifies masks for files that will be stored without compression.
member.remarks:
NoCompressionMasks are used for overloaded versions without parameters of , , , , and methods to store certain files without compression. This property should contain list of excluded directories and file names including wildcard characters. For example, "C:\\TEST\\*.*" specifies all files in the 'C:\TEST' directory.
property specifiec files that should be included into the operation, excluding files specified by .

member.name: P:ComponentAce.Compression.Archiver.BaseArchiver.InMemory
member.summary: Indicates if an archive file is stored in memory.
member.remarks:
Indicates whether the current archive file is stored in memory (RAM). Set this property to True when you want to create a new or open an existing archive file in memory. If you set it to False file will be opened or created on disk, with the name defined by property. Setting InMemory to False when archive file is opened will cause writing the content of the archive file to disk. Set this property to True when you need to load content of the archvie file into memory.
It is not recommended to set InMemory to True with large archive files. ZipForge.NET includes transaction system that optimizes the speed of archives updating.

member.name: T:ComponentAce.Compression.Archiver.StorePathMode
member.summary: Describes how path infromation will be stored for the file or directory within the archive file.
member.remarks:
StorePathMode value defines how path information will be stored for the file or directory within the archive file. If you need to store all files and directories without path you should use NoPath value. For example, AddFiles("C:\TEST\test.txt") adds file test.txt to the archive. If you will extract it by ExtractFiles("*.*") and BaseDir will be "C:\", file test.txt will be extracted to "C\":, not to "C:\TEST".
If you need to store path relative to certain directory you should set BaseDir before adding file to archive and set Options.StorePath to Relative. In this case if you will set BaseDir to "C:\" and call AddFiles("C:\TEST\test.txt") the file test.txt will be stored as "TEST\test.txt" within the archive. If you will extract it by ExtractFiles("*.*") it will be extracted to "C:\TEST\test.txt", not to "C:\" as in previous example.
If you need to store full path you should set Options.StorePath to FullPath. Previous example will store test.txt within the archive file as "\TEST\test.txt" and file will be extracted to disk specified by BaseDir.
If you need to store absolute path with drive you should set Options.StorePath to FullPathWithDrive. Previous AddFiles example will store test.txt within the archive file as "C:\TEST\test.txt" and the file will be extracted to disk using stored absolute path regardless of BaseDir.

member.name: F:ComponentAce.Compression.Archiver.StorePathMode.NoPath
member.summary: No path information stored.

member.name: F:ComponentAce.Compression.Archiver.StorePathMode.RelativePath
member.summary: Path information stored relatively BaseDir.

member.name: F:ComponentAce.Compression.Archiver.StorePathMode.FullPath
member.summary: Path information stored relatively disk specified by BaseDir.

member.name: F:ComponentAce.Compression.Archiver.StorePathMode.FullPathWithDrive
member.summary: Absolute path with drive letter stored. Non-standard extension of PKZip format.

member.name: T:ComponentAce.Compression.Archiver.Zip64Mode
member.summary: Specifies a zip file format.
member.remarks:
Use Zip64Mode for creating Zip64 archives. Thus you can create archive files > 4Gb and add files > 4 Gb to the archive. Set Zip64Mode to zmAlways to add files in Zip64 format. Use zmAuto for auto-detection of the archive format depending on sizes of the files being added. zmDisabled is a default value for creating archives in normal Zip format, compatible with most of archivers.
Zip64 format is not supported by some archivers. ZipForge uses the same foramt as PKZip. Nethertheless we do not guarantee that it is compatible with other programs.

member.name: F:ComponentAce.Compression.Archiver.Zip64Mode.Disabled
member.summary: A default value for creating archives in normal Zip format.

member.name: F:ComponentAce.Compression.Archiver.Zip64Mode.Auto
member.summary: Auto-detection of the archive format depending on sizes of the files being added.

member.name: F:ComponentAce.Compression.Archiver.Zip64Mode.Always
member.summary: Always create archives in Zip64 format.

member.name: P:ComponentAce.Compression.Archiver.SpanningOptions.AdvancedNaming
member.summary: Determines how the archive volumes will be named.
member.remarks:
If AdvancedNaming is set to True then archive volumes will be named like archive_001.zip, archive_002.zip, ... ,archive_999.zip.
If AdvancedNaming is set to False and SpanningMode is set to smSpanning then archive volumes will be named like archive.zip on each removable disk.
If AdvancedNaming is set to False and SpanningMode is set to smSplitting then archive volumes will be named like archive.z01, archive.z02, ... , archive.z99.
You can also specify custom name for each volume using event handler.

member.name: P:ComponentAce.Compression.Archiver.SpanningOptions.FirstVolumeSize
member.summary: Specifies the size of first volume in bytes.
member.remarks: The FirstVolumeSize specifies the size of first volume, minimum size is 64 Kb. If the FirstVolumeSize is set to 0 the size of the first volume will be the same as other volumes and will be defined by VolumeSize value.

member.name: P:ComponentAce.Compression.Archiver.SpanningOptions.VolumeSize
member.summary: Specifies the size of the volumes for archive splitting or spanning.
member.remarks: The VolumeSize specifies the size of the volumes for archive splitting or spanning. If the VolumeSize is set to vsCustom, then CustomVolumeSize will be used.

member.name: P:ComponentAce.Compression.Archiver.SpanningOptions.CustomVolumeSize
member.summary: Specifies the custom size of the volumes for archive splitting or spanning.
member.remarks: The CustomVolumeSize specifies the custom size of the volumes for archive splitting or spanning. This parameter can be used only when VolumeSize is set to vsCustom.

member.summary: Specifies if archive operation will search files recursively.
member.remarks: Recurse specifies if , , , , , and methods will search files recursively. This means that if some folder meets search conditions then all files and directories within this folder will be scanned. For example, if you set Recurse to true and call AddFiles("C:\\*.*",FileAttributes.Nornal) all files and folders located on disk C: will be added to the archive.
